newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's 97 budget deficit non-negotiable - minister.
newsitem.headline: Russia's 97 budget deficit non-negotiable - minister.

text.p: Economy Minister Yevgeny Yasin, responding to parliament's rejection of the 1997 draft budget, said on Wednesday that he would change the budget, but would not increase the budget deficit.

"Under no circumstances is it possible to increase the budget deficit," he told reporters after the Duma lower house of parliament rejected the draft and asked for changes to key figures. "I don't see any room for concession on this issue.
"Stepping up borrowing would disrupt the entire process of resuming economic growth and restoring Russia's economy."
The draft had spending of 524.34 trillion roubles, revenues of 433.64 trillion roubles and a deficit of 90.70 trillion, or 3.3 percent of the gross domestic product.
"We have very little room for manoeuvering with regard to reducing key budget parameters," Yasin said, adding that projected revenues and spending could both be cut.
Finance Minister Alexander Livshits had said earlier that he would re-submit a tighter budget.

"We will reduce incomes, spending and maybe the deficit. We are being asked to meet the president's budget outline and that has a deficit of three percent (of GDP), while we have 3.3 percent," he said.
